questions.question_text: A systems administrator is patching virtual servers in a private cloud environment and must ensure any failure induced by patching is resolved as soon as possible. Which of the following is the best method for addressing this issue?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Explanation:
Snapshots allow administrators to quickly revert a virtual machine to a previous state before the patching process.
If the patch causes a failure, the snapshot can be restored almost instantly, minimizing downtime.
This method is faster than restoring from a backup, which can take longer depending on storage and network speeds.

choices.D: Sending an alert to the on-call engineer if patching on a server fails for any reason
choices.A: Uninstalling patches if the server is unresponsive after being patched
choices.B: Taking a full backup before patching and restoring from backup if the server is unresponsive after being patched
choices.C: Taking a snapshot before patching and reverting to the snapshot if a server is unresponsive after being patched

questions.question_text: An organization is using IoT devices at an external location. Which of the following should the IT staff leverage in order to improve the performance of processing the IoT data?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Explanation:
IoT devices generate large amounts of data that need to be processed efficiently and quickly. Edge computing helps by processing data closer to the source (IoT devices) instead of sending it to a centralized cloud or data center.

Why Edge Computing?
✔ Reduces latency – Data is processed near the IoT devices, leading to faster response times.
✔ Optimizes bandwidth usage – Less data is sent to the cloud, reducing network congestion.
✔ Enhances reliability – IoT devices can continue working even with intermittent internet connections.
✔ Improves security – Sensitive data can be processed locally before being sent to the cloud.

questions.question_text: A cloud administrator notices VMs on a particular host are having performance issues. The administrator also determines this host has more VMs than the others in the cluster. Which of the following is the primary cause of the performance issues?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A is correct

Oversubscription occurs when more VMs are allocated to a host than its physical resources (CPU, RAM, storage, etc.) can handle effectively. This results in resource contention, causing performance issues for VMs on that host.

questions.question_text:
A cloud engineer gathered the following requirements for a factory automation system:

• Assembly line systems are latency sensitive.
• Internet connectivity issues are common and can be prolonged.
• Services must support a 99.999% system uptime.

Which of the following components would be useful in implementing a hybrid model? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BC
A hybrid cloud model balances cloud and on-premises infrastructure to meet the factory's latency, uptime, and connectivity requirements.

(B) Cloud edge devices – These devices bring compute and storage closer to the factory to reduce latency and ensure local processing even during internet outages.
(C) Local services – Keeping critical automation systems on-premises ensures that assembly line operations continue even if cloud connectivity is lost.
